text:
Data may be measured using different scales.
• Nominal scale—data is put into categories that have no particular order.
Ordinal scale—data is put into categories that can be ordered with respect to some
characteristic.
Interval scale—differences in data values are meaningful, but ratios, such as twice as
much or twice as large, are not meaningful.
Ratio scaleratios of values, such as twice as much or half as large, are meaningful,
and zero represents the complete absence of the characteristic being measured.
